ConceptDef.label: AvP: Unblooded
ConceptDef.helpText: Some Yautja will be Unblooded. Which is to say they haven't got a worthy kill yet and have a permanent mood penalty because of it.\n\nIn order to get rid of this penalty, the Yautja needs to have the killing blow on a worthy prey (big predators, other pawns) and mark themselves with it.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Blooding
ConceptDef.helpText:
When a Yautja kill a worthy prey, they will have the option to mark themself with the blood of the kill.

Find the creature the pawn killed in its health tab. Then right-click the creature and choose the option to mark yourself with it. Once done, the Yautja will get a permanent boost to mood.

 As the Yautja kill stronger games, they will be able to mark themsleves again and get a better permanent mood bonus.

 If the creature the Yautja killed is accidently destroyed before they can amrk themself, you can use the blood of a similar prey to mark the Yautja.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Cocoons
ConceptDef.helpText:
Xenomorphs will kidnap downed pawn and bring them back to a safe place and cocoon them.

 The cocoon will keep the pawn alive and healthy until a Facehugger can impregnate the pawn. You can save the pawn by right-clicking the cocoon and selecting the option.

 If no Facehugger can impregnate the pawn, after a while the cocoon will disolve the colonist and transform into an egg.

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Facehuggers
ConceptDef.helpText: Facehuggers will attach themselves to pawns and big animals in order to reproduce. It is possible to remove a Facehugger through a very risky surgery.\n\n Do so at your own risk!

ConceptDef.label: AvP: Xenomorph Embryos
ConceptDef.helpText:
Once impregnated, a pawn lives on borrowed time.

 It is possible to remove the Embryo through surgery.

 Do so at your own risk!
